metadata.name: Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension
metadata.comment: Detects a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with a custom extension

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\brave.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\chrome.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\msedge.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\opera.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\vivaldi.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--load-extension=')))

output.summary: Detects a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with a custom extension

metadata.objective: False positive: Usage of Chrome Extensions in testing tools such as BurpSuite will trigger this alert References: https://redcanary.com/blog/chromeloader/, https://emkc.org/s/RJjuLa, https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/lnk-between-browsers
